chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b : Z, 1 < a -> 1 < b -> b < a -> ~ prime a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> exists q b0 : Z, a = Z.mul q b0 /\ 1 < q /\ 1 < b0

Premises:
Inductive prime (p : Z) : Prop := prime_intro : 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p Arguments prime _%Z_scope Arguments prime_intro _%Z_scope _ _%function_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : Z => Zis_gcd a b 1 : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_dec_gen : forall a b : Z, 1 < b -> b < a -> (forall c : Z, b < c < a -> rel_prime c a) -> prime a \/ ~ prime a
Z.pow_lt_mono_l : forall a b c : Z, 0 < c -> 0 <= a < b -> a ^ c < b ^ c
relp_mult1 : forall a b c d k : Z, 0 <= a -> 0 <= b -> 0 < c -> 0 <= d -> a = k * c -> b = k * d -> rel_prime a b -> k = 1
Z.pow_gt_1 : forall a b : Z, 1 < a -> 0 < b < -> 1 < a ^ b
rel_prime_cross_prod : forall a b c d : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime c d -> b > 0 -> d > 0 -> a * d = b * c -> a = c /\ b = d
Zrel_prime_neq_mod_0 : forall a b : Z, 1 < b -> rel_prime a b -> a mod b <> 0
not_prime_divide : forall p : Z, 1 < p -> ~ prime p -> exists n : Z, 1 < n < p /\ (n | p)
rel_prime_mult : forall a b c : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime a c -> rel_prime a (b * c)
Zis_gcd_unique : forall a b c d : Z, Zis_gcd a b c -> Zis_gcd a b d -> c = d \/ c = - d
rel_prime_le_prime : forall a p : Z, prime p -> 1 <= a < p -> rel_prime a p
relp_mult3 : forall a b c : Z, rel_prime (a * b) c -> rel_prime a c
Zdivide_intro : forall a b q : Z, b = q * a -> (a | b)
bezout_rel_prime : forall a b : Z, Bezout a b 1 -> rel_prime a b
rel_prime_bezout : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> Bezout a b 1
QArith_base.Qlt_shift_div_l : forall a b c : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qlt {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} c -> QArith_base.Qlt (QArith_base.Qmult a c) b -> QArith_base.Qlt a (QArith_base.Qdiv b c)
Gauss : forall a b c : Z, (a | b * c) -> rel_prime a b -> (a | c)
divide_mult_l : forall a b c : Z, c <> 0 -> (c * a | c * b) -> (a | b)
prime_intro : forall p : Z, 1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> prime p
prime' = fun p : Z => 1 < p /\ (forall n : Z, 1 < n < p -> ~ (n | p)) : Z -> Prop Arguments prime' _%Z_scope
prime_dec_aux : forall p m : Z, {forall n : Z, 1 < n < m -> rel_prime n p} + {exists n : Z, 1 < n < m /\ ~ rel_prime n p}
rel_prime_mod : forall p q : Z, 0 < q -> rel_prime p q -> rel_prime (p mod q) q
rel_prime_mod_rev : forall p q : Z, 0 < q -> rel_prime (p mod q) q -> rel_prime p q
relp_mult2 : forall a b : Z, rel_prime (a * b) a -> a = 1 \/ a = -1
Znumtheory.rel_prime_sym : forall a b : Z, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime b a
divide_sum : forall a b c : Z, (a | b) -> (a | b + c) -> (a | c)
Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : Z, (g | a) -> (g | b) -> (forall x : Z, (x | a) -> (x | b) -> (x | g)) -> Zis_gcd a b g
R_prime = fun x y : Z => 1 < x /\ 1 < y /\ x < y : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments R_prime (_ _)%Z_scope
divide_trans : forall a b c : Z, (a | b) -> (b | c) -> (a | c)
prime_rec : forall (p : Z) (P : Set), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
prime_rect : forall (p : Z) (P : Type), (1 < p -> (forall n : Z, 1 <= n < p -> rel_prime n p) -> P) -> prime p -> P
